description: Enhancing the Democratic Rule of Law through Strengthening the Justice System in Timor-Leste (Revised Justice System Programme)

subproject.corporate outcome: Effective, responsive, accessible and fair justice systems promote the rule of law, including both formal and informal processes, with due consideration on the rights of the poor, women and vulnerable groups
subproject.description: The first phase of the JSP was launched in 2003. In 2005 the project was revised and a new phase began and ended in 2008. The current JSP is the result of the second revision and focuses on the achievement of the following 6 strategic outcomes: 1) Enhancement of skills and competencies of justice sector actors; 2) Support the justice decentralization process; 3) Strengthen the Prosecution Services; 4) Strengthen capacity of the corrections services to uphold public safety; 5) Enhance access to justice for all; 6) establish the CEO of the Programme
donor_long: OFFICE OF THE HIGH COMMISSIONER FOR HR
subproject.gender code: Gender equality as a significant objective
subproject.title: Support to Justice Sector
